title: Understanding Analytical Separations
text: Analytical separations are crucial in chemistry for isolating specific components from a mixture. This process allows chemists to study individual substances without interference from other components.

title: Why Separate Components?
text: Consider why it might be important to isolate individual components in a mixture. Think about how this could affect the accuracy and precision of your analysis.

hintAnswer: To isolate and identify individual components in a mixture
title: Identifying the Goal
text: What is the primary goal of performing an analytical separation?
choices: To isolate and identify individual components in a mixture
To increase the concentration of a solution
To change the chemical structure of a compound
To measure the pH of a solution
